column4: would someone kindly try to login to my server using ssh 74.106.4.22 (just setup key based login and hoping it kicks back any password attempts)
It asks me to input password
Because, half the time it gets sent to people's Junkmail
this is frustrating... grr... ok just disabled rsaauthentication and pubkeyauthentication and reloaded the config file and its still allowing me to login using keys... what am I doing wrong here...

ok... so I tested it some... turns out my initial trials were foiled when I forgot to escalate priveleges when I tried to reload the config file.   Solved that (duh).  Could you give it one more shot for me?
or could anyone here give me a hand and see if I disabled password login effectively.  IP is 74.106.4.22

you still around?  Got one more question about the printing of the MOTD.  For some reason when using password login this works but after setting up keys it goes away... the nice thing was that during logons it would tell you if the server required a reboot...  is there any way to re-enable this?
